@prabhjyotsingh Thank you for great improvement!
I tested this with mysql and all features are working well except one.
In following case, database connection would be closed and user should `use db` command again.
so I think it needs something for managing connection state.
1. use db
2. execute right query.
3. execute fail query.
4. execute right query : then db connection would be closed.

What do you think?

LGTM!

I just pushed changes to keep compatibility using `ZEPPELIN_IMPERSONATE_SPARK_PROXY_USER` env. variable that will disable usage of `--proxy-user` option.  after [SPARK-19143](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-19143) resolved, maybe can come back to it again.

**For reviewers**

Fixed to use `spark.jars` instead of `classpath`. 

- classpath doesn't include submitted jars at this moment (i could get 7 days ago, but not now)
- it help to simplify logic since we can set PYTHONPATH directly in `setupPySparkEnv` function. 
- also, `spark.jars` includes only required jars. (jars in classpath are more verbose)
- I tested in spark 1.6.2, spark 2.0.0 

@zjffdu 

The spark code we talked came from https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/6360. It seems like intended so it's ok not to raise an issue.

great, we are good to go then, yeah?

@minahlee btw, should we update the hadoop-2.4 in the release script - we are testing against 2.6 in CI and almost everyone out there should be running at least 2.6??

hmm, it doesn't break RAT tests for all these binaries? :)
just a thought, LGTM.
this is important - is there any backward compatibility concerns with changing the password storage?
Tests LGTM. Thanks!

@felixcheung JCEKS is used only when the password field is empty. When password and JCEKS properties are empty the connection attempt is made without password.

edit: Updated the PR description with settings for clear text password vs JCEKS stored password

@r-kamath IMO this shouldn't be called "backward compatibility" as these are two ways in which password can provided to interpreter.

Does this PR resolve flaky test that current master encounters?
@minahlee I think `-Pr` doesn't mean anything because users cannot run R interpreter since `-Psparkr` is enabled. How about removing `-Pr` in a script?
I'm not sure, this PR is intent to fix the dead lock issue.
Flaky test may be another concurrency issue in scheduler execute jobs.
